Crown copyright material is reproduced with the permission of the Controller of HMSO and the Queen's Printer for Scotland</copyright>       </prodStmt>       <distStmt>         <distrbtr>UK Data Service</distrbtr>         <depositr>Insalaco, F.</depositr>         <depDate date="2000-10-05T00:00:00Z">05 October 2000</depDate>         <distDate date="2000-10-16T00:00:00Z">16 October 2000</distDate>       </distStmt>       <verStmt>         <version date="2000-10-16T00:00:00Z">1</version>       </verStmt>       <holdings URI="http://dx.doi.org/10.5255/UKDA-SN-4189-1" />     </citation>     <stdyInfo>       <subject>         <keyword>1999</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/93785cf4-23d1-4d38-84a3-375fa66223d5">EMPLOYMENT</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/a88887cd-0807-4b8e-aa66-045bea330bc5">GREAT BRITAIN</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/0453fabb-1975-43c2-a8f1-e1af609d61b4">OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/694d0f82-c1bf-4148-a289-8aba19443218">RISK</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/fd5cb368-4b51-44f6-970c-908acad4bf55">WAGES</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/04e82af3-e6ca-4600-ba3b-9837fe476ba5">WORKING CONDITIONS</keyword>         <topcClas>General - Employment and labour</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The research project looked at whether jobs that were prone to accidents (and therefore put workers at greater risk of being physically hurt) offered higher wages as compensation. This hypothesis was tested using a wages equation. If economic theory is correct, it would be expected that jobs which are more prone to accident would indeed offer a higher wage.</abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br> The dataset consists of a selection of variables taken from Wave 1 of the British Household Panel Survey (BHPS). Additional variables were derived from these BHPS variables. In addition, three variables created from data from the Winter quarters of the 1993, 1994, 1995, 1996 and 1997 Quarterly Labour Force Surveys (QLFS - see SNs 3221, 3442, 3559, 3718 and 3829) are also included. The aggregated data are contained in .csv format files, 'jobrisk1.csv', 'jobrisk2.csv' and 'jobrisk3.csv', and were used to create the variables 'riskmain', 'riskminm' and 'riskmajm' in the main dataset.</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate>The dataset was compiled in 1999 from earlier BHPS and QLFS data - see 'Main Topics' section for full details.</collDate>         <nation>Great Britain</nation>         <geogUnit>No spatial unit</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Employees</universe>         <universe>Male employees in Great Britain, respondents of BHPS Wave 1, with a recorded hourly (gross) wage of between one pound and 35 pounds sterling.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <sampProc>See BHPS Wave 1 documentation on how the sample was selected.</sampProc>         <collMode>See BHPS Wave 1 documentation</collMode>         <sources>           <dataSrc>Data were derived from the BHPS and QLFS - see 'Main Topics' section for full details.</dataSrc>         </sources>         <weight>No information recorded</weight>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Standard conditions of access</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. The depositor may be informed about usage. See <a href=http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/get-data/how-to-access/conditions.aspx>terms and conditions of access</a> for further information.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
